case_title: Criminal Appeals Nos.23, 24 and Murder Reference No.9 of 1997 vs THE STATE
reference_no_or_id: Criminal Appeal No.37, Criminal Revision No.25 and Murder Reference No.201 of 1996

defense: Counsel for Anees alias Muhammad Umar

complaint_summary: On 24-9-1997, Azhar Ehsan was murdered during a robbery attempt by Muhammad Yousaf and Anees alias Muhammad Umar. The incident occurred near a fruit shop in Multan, witnessed by Ashfaq Ahmad, Saadullah Khan, and Amar Ibrahim.
investigation_summary: Police apprehended the accused at the scene with the weapon and motorcycle. Evidence included blood-stained earth, a .30 bore pistol, and witness statements. Post-mortem confirmed fatal injuries caused by gunfire.
judgment_summary: Muhammad Yousaf's conviction under Section 302, P.P.C. was set aside, but his conviction under Section 392, P.P.C. was upheld. Anees alias Muhammad Umar's death sentence under Section 302, P.P.C. and conviction under Section 392, P.P.C. were confirmed.
punishment: Muhammad Yousaf: Rigorous imprisonment for 10 years and fine of Rs. 20,000 under Section 392, P.P.C. Anees alias Muhammad Umar: Death sentence under Section 302, P.P.C. and rigorous imprisonment for 10 years with fine under Section 392, P.P.C.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeals dismissed. Death sentence for Anees alias Muhammad Umar confirmed.
legal_arguments: Defense argued lack of common intention for murder by Muhammad Yousaf.
Prosecution argued collective responsibility for murder during robbery.
Defense for Anees argued mitigating circumstances due to young age and intent to escape.

witness_statement.Ashfaq Ahmad: Confirmed robbery attempt and firing by Anees alias Muhammad Umar.
witness_statement.Saadit Mehdi: Recorded statements and collected evidence at the scene.

key_issues: Whether Muhammad Yousaf shared common intention for murder.
Applicability of mitigating circumstances for Anees alias Muhammad Umar.

maxims.actus reus: Physical act of robbery and murder established.
maxims.mens rea: Intent to kill inferred from firing at the deceased.

legal_terms.robbery: Taking property by force or threat.

summary_vector_notes: Case involves robbery and murder. Muhammad Yousaf's conviction for murder set aside due to lack of common intention. Anees alias Muhammad Umar sentenced to death for murder during robbery. Evidence includes witness accounts, weapon, and post-mortem report.
